ModuleDescription: This course will touch upon a broad range of fields in entrepreneurial finance. This course analyzes essential issues and problems facing entrepreneurial enterprises from starting-up, raising financial resources, managing and sustaining growth, as well as exiting stategies. The course is case oriented, with real-world cases studied beforehand and analyzed and discussed in class. The aim of this course is to prepare students for careers related to entrepreneurial enterprisesâ€”as founder, employee, investor, banker or provider of consulting or financial services to these businesses.
